Talk1022:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>Sorry, but nothing comes between the
two of us, not even you.<sp:0:4:0>I met my wife in <clr:0000>Lurelin Village<clr:ffff>, to the
south of here.<sp:0:4:0>She's the most beautiful woman in
Hateno Village. Maybe even all of Hyrule!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500>The two of us have always guarded the
windmills in shifts.<sp:0:4:0>Except something bad is happening in her
hometown, and she's been pretty broken
up about it.<sp:0:4:0>She's at home now resting.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_01>I picked this spot because you can see
both the windmills and my house clearly
from here.<sp:0:4:0>If anything happens, I can come running
at once.
Talk1023:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal>Sorry. This is the perfect spot to keep an
eye both on the windmills and my <clr:0000>darling
wife<clr:ffff>. I'm not giving it up.<sp:0:4:0>Your time would be better spent checking
out the <clr:0000>farm <clr:ffff>or the <clr:0000>research lab<clr:ffff>.
Comment_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Admiration_01>So you're our savior, huh? I thought
you'd be tougher looking.<sp:0:4:0>But you must be pretty strong beneath
the surface.<sp:0:4:0>Did I tell you before in Hateno Village that
my wife is from here?<sp:0:4:0>She'd been feeling awful ever since those
pirates attacked.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>But after you sent them packing, we
decided it was time to move.<sp:0:4:0>Guess I should start learning the ins and
outs of the Lurelin dialect.
Talk1024:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:QuestionSurprise_01>Oh, were you not on your way to Hateno
Pasture up ahead?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>I know most folks here are obsessed with
<clr:0000>Cece-brand<clr:ffff> fashion right now.<sp:0:4:0>But the best thing about this village
is and always will be the bounty of
its farmlands.<sp:0:4:0>Have a bottle of our freshly squeezed
milk, and you'll know what I mean.
Comment_05:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:QuestionSurprise_01>Huh. Are you the one who saved the
village? I thought you'd look tougher.<sp:0:4:0>You must be pretty strong beneath
the surface.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm from Hateno Village, but my wife is
from here originally.<sp:0:4:0>She'd been feeling awful ever since those
pirates attacked.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>But after you sent them packing, we
decided it was time to move.<sp:0:4:0>Guess I should start learning the ins and
outs of the Lurelin dialect.
Talk1025:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Notice_00>Huh? So you weren't on your way to the
research lab up the hill?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>They started that place as a center to
research ancient ruins.<sp:0:4:0>Now, though, I've heard they're hard at
work on some kind of...padding, I think?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700>Anyway, for a while the place was quiet,
but now Robbie's back again.<sp:0:4:0>So the banging and clanging is as fierce
as it ever was.<sp:0:4:0>Whatever this padding they're hard at
work on is, my bet is that it'll go down as
one of the <clr:0000>great inventions<clr:ffff> of the century.
Comment_08:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Thank you not just for rebuilding this
village, but for whatever you did to help
my wife with her work.<sp:0:4:0>She's a happier woman for it, I'll tell you
that much.
Talk1010:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>My wife's been fretting over whether
there's anything she can do to help make
Lurelin Village famous.<sp:0:4:0>She's at <clr:0000>the village head's house<clr:ffff> if you
want to hear it directly from her.<sp:0:4:0>It's gotten so bad, I can barely sleep at
night next to the sound of her muttering.<sp:0:4:0>I'm here to pray to the sea that she finds
the answer she's looking for.
Talk1029:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Isn't this spot nice and quiet? Not like
the bustle of the village below.<sp:0:4:0>My wife and I like Cece well enough, but
all that commotion is a bit much for us.
Talk1011:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>A beautiful wife, good food, and that
breathtaking sea view! What could be
better than this?
Talk1012:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh, Ralera... <sp:5:0:0>You're more beautiful than
the lapping waves under the rising sun.
Talk1013:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_00>Ah, Ralera... <sp:5:0:0>You're prettier than the sky
with all its stars.
Talk1014:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>Hee-hee. You must have said that to me
ten thousand times by now.
Talk1015:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice_01>Ooh! A shooting star! I wonder what we'd
find if we went to where it fell?
Talk1040:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Well then, where are you going? The only
other place around here is the <clr:0000>farm<clr:ffff>.
Talk1017:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>A beautiful wife and that breathtaking sea
view! This is the life!
Talk1018:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Hey there. A fellow rain fan, are you?
I love it outdoors in the rain. It makes
the land smell so rich and alive.
Talk1041:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Well then, where are you going?<sp:0:4:0>If you came out here, you must be after
either the <clr:0000>farm <clr:ffff>or the <clr:0000>research lab<clr:ffff>.
Talk1019:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Morning. Nice weather to get some
sunlight, isn't it?
Talk1042:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If you weren't headed to the <clr:0000>farm<clr:ffff>...maybe
you're looking for the <clr:0000>research lab<clr:ffff>?
Talk1001:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Trouble>I thought moving to this village would
make my wife happy again.<sp:0:4:0>But she's just been fretting over whether
there's anything she can do to help make
Lurelin Village famous.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>She's at <clr:0000>the village head's house<clr:ffff> if you
want to hear it directly from her.<sp:0:4:0>Who knows? Maybe talking it out with
someone outside the situation will help
her come up with something.
Talk1043:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Sorry. Once I start talking about my wife,
it's hard to know when to stop.
Talk1002:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The menu for the food here changes
every time I come. I eat here every day,
and I'm still not tired of it.
Talk1044:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Trouble>I thought moving to this village would
make my wife happy again.<sp:0:4:0>But she's just been fretting over whether
there's anything she can do to help make
Lurelin Village famous.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>She's <clr:0000>out front<clr:ffff> if you want to hear it
directly from her.<sp:0:4:0>Who knows? Maybe talking it out with
someone outside the situation will help
her come up with something.
Comment_10:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Hey there. <sp:5:0:0>Good morning. Too bad about
this weather, huh?
Talk1006:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_00>Oh, Ralera...<sp:5:0:0> You're more beautiful than
the lapping waves under the setting sun.
Comment_11:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Hey there. <sp:5:0:0>Good afternoon. Too bad about
this weather, huh?
Talk1007:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>My wife's been fretting over whether
there's anything she can do to help make
Lurelin Village famous.<sp:0:4:0>She's at <clr:0000>the village head's house<clr:ffff> if you
want to hear it directly from her.<sp:0:4:0>Who knows? Maybe talking it out with
someone outside the situation will help
her come up with something.
Talk1031:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Hah! I'm just kidding you.<sp:0:4:0>No doubt you're here looking for the <clr:0000>farm<clr:ffff>
or the <clr:0000>research lab<clr:ffff>.
Comment_12:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Hey there. <sp:5:0:0>Good evening. Too bad about
this weather, huh?
Talk1008:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Trouble>I thought moving to this village would
make my wife happy again.<sp:0:4:0>But she's just been fretting over whether
there's anything she can do to help make
Lurelin Village famous.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>She's at <clr:0000>the village head's house<clr:ffff> if you
want to hear it directly from her.<sp:0:4:0>It's gotten so bad, I can barely sleep at
night next to the sound of her muttering.<sp:0:4:0>I'm here to pray to the sea that she finds
the answer she's looking for.
Talk1032:
<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:QuestionAngry>You haven't come to steal away my
<clr:0000>darling wife<clr:ffff>, have you?
Talk1009:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Do you mind if I get out of this rain before
we talk?
Talk1033:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Notice_00>Huh? So you weren't on your way to the
research lab up the hill?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Just as well, I suppose.<sp:0:4:0>The lab's empty. Purah and Robbie, the
researchers who used it, have gone off to
<clr:0000>Lookout Landing<clr:ffff> near Hyrule Castle.
Talk1034: <sp:3:0:2:0701>I keep seeing you around here.<sp:0:4:0>Hang on...<sp:5:1:0>uh-oh.<sp:5:1:0>
Talk1035:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>So...are we done here? I don't want to
take my eyes off the windmills or the
house for too long.
Talk1036:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Next to what my wife's going through,
skipping a night's sleep to guard the
windmills is nothing.<sp:0:4:0>The hard part is when I'm done and go
back home to see her so downhearted.
Talk1020:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hello. Nice weather to feel the breeze,
isn't it?
Talk1038:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I liked life in Hateno Village, but I can't
deny how nice it is here in Lurelin.<sp:0:4:0>I'm thinking I might stay here a while,
especially since I've got my lovely wife
to keep me company.<sp:0:4:0>An easy life where I get to look out to sea
whenever I want isn't half bad.
Talk1021:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Evening. Nice night to be under the stars,
isn't it?
Talk1039:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If you weren't headed to the <clr:0000>research
lab<clr:ffff>...maybe you're looking for the <clr:0000>farm<clr:ffff>?
